thread.title: University applications webchat: ask the experts
thread.title_full: University applications webchat: ask the experts - Telegraph

author: Josie Gurney-Read , Online Education Editor
title: University applications webchat: ask the experts
text: Do you have questions regarding A-level Results Day , Clearing , university applications or student finance ? Join us on Wednesday 22nd July between 1pm and 3pm for your chance to put questions to Ross Sanger from Ucas (1pm to 2pm) and Mark Lee Kelly from Student Finance England (2pm to 3pm). Get your questions over in advance by emailing josie.gurney-read@telegraph.co.uk or by tweeting @JosieGurneyRead . • Download the Telegraph's Clearing app for iPhone and Android Live Blog University applications webchat: ask the experts A-level Results Day With A-level Results Day approaching on August 13, it's understandable if doubts are beginning to creep in about exam performance. As has been written many times before, if you are worried about your results, your best solution now is research . Get on the internet and make sure you have a viable 'Plan B' that you are happy with. Look into alternative courses, alternative universities, or simply consider taking a year out to evaluate your options. If you're still stuck, or are worried about some aspect of your current application, take part in our webchat. You'll be able to put your questions to the experts and hopefully alliviate some of your worries in the process. Can't take part on the day? Then email your questions to j.gurney-read@telegraph.co.uk in advance and we will put them to Ross and Mark on your behalf. Do remember though, for obvious reasons we won't be able to answer any questions regarding your personal information, including passwords. Check back here at 1pm on July 22 and make sure you are confident about your options when you wake on Results Day. Useful links: • Step-by-step guide to Clearing • Step-by-step guide to Adjustment • Step-by-step guide to Results Day • Download the Telegraph's Clearing app for iPhone and Android Follow @telegraph
